activities:
(1) The organization’s U.S.-based employees may process employees’ personal data received from the EEA and Switzerland for any and all employment-related purposes, including, but not limited to, workforce management; administering compensation, payroll, and benefits; administering physical and information systems security; addressing various legal obligations related to the employment relationship; and to administer training.
(2) Names, street or email addresses, phone numbers, or other information provided by the organization's customers and visitors to its website.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: (1) Any personal data in electronic or paper form regarding the organization’s employees located in the EEA or Switzerland. (2) Any personal data provided by the organization's customers and visitors to its web site
recoursemech: The EU Data Protection Authorities and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner
